skill.name: azure-validate
skill.description: Pre-deployment validation checkpoint. Run deep checks to ensure your application is ready for Azure deployment. Validates configuration, infrastructure, permissions, and prerequisites. USE FOR: validate my app, check deployment readiness, run preflight checks, verify configuration, check if ready to deploy, validate azure.yaml, validate Bicep, test before deploying, troubleshoot deployment errors. DO NOT USE FOR: creating or building apps (use azure-prepare), executing deployments (use azure-deploy).
skill.summary: Pre-deployment validation checkpoint ensuring Azure deployment readiness
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is legitimate Microsoft Azure deployment validation documentation. Scanner detected documentation examples in markdown code blocks (e.g., 'az version', 'az account show'), standard Azure config paths (.azure/plan.md), relative markdown links (../../policy-validation.md), and documentation URLs. This is an official Microsoft skill for Azure deployment validation.

content.value_statement: Before deploying to Azure, developers need confidence their infrastructure code and configuration are valid. This skill performs comprehensive pre-deployment validation including Bicep compilation, Terraform validation, Azure CLI checks, and policy compliance verification.
actual_capabilities: Validate Bicep templates with az bicep build
Validate Terraform configurations with terraform validate
Run Azure CLI deployment previews with az deployment sub what-if
Verify Azure Policy compliance for subscriptions
limitations: Does not execute actual deployments (use azure-deploy skill)
Does not create or modify infrastructure code
Requires azure-prepare to have been run first
Cannot validate without proper Azure authentication

best_practices: Always run azure-validate after azure-prepare and before azure-deploy
Address all validation failures before attempting deployment
Record validation proof in .azure/plan.md for audit trail
anti_patterns: Skipping validation and deploying directly to save time
Deploying without first verifying azure-prepare completed successfully

faq.question: What is azure-validate?
faq.answer: Azure-validate is a pre-deployment validation skill that checks if your application and infrastructure are ready for Azure deployment. It validates configuration, compiles Bicep/Terraform, checks authentication, and verifies policy compliance.

faq.question: When should I use azure-validate?
faq.answer: Use azure-validate after running azure-prepare and before running azure-deploy. It is the mandatory validation step in the Azure deployment workflow.

faq.question: What tools does azure-validate check?
faq.answer: The skill validates Azure CLI, Bicep templates, Terraform configurations, Azure Developer CLI (azd), and Azure Policy compliance.

faq.question: Can azure-validate deploy resources?
faq.answer: No, azure-validate only performs read-only validation checks. Use the azure-deploy skill for actual deployment execution.

faq.question: What happens if validation fails?
faq.answer: If validation fails, the skill provides error resolution guidance. You must fix all failures before proceeding to azure-deploy.

faq.question: Does azure-validate require Azure authentication?
faq.answer: Yes, azure-validate requires valid Azure authentication (via az login or Azure Developer CLI). It verifies your identity and subscription before running validation checks.
